greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest x such that the number of nonprimes (i.e., 1 and composites) in the reduced residue set (RSS(x)) of x equals n, or 0 if there are no such x.
comment: See A074915 for a bound on A048864(x) which allows to establish a search range for a(n). - _Giovanni Resta_, Feb 25 2020
link: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Abhijit A J, A. Satyanarayana Reddy, Number of non-primes in the set of units modulo n, arXiv:1907.09908 [math.GM], 2019.
formula: a(n) = min{x; A048864(x)=n}; a(n)=0 if no such number exists.
mathematica: f[x_] := EulerPhi[x]-PrimePi[x]+Length[FactorInteger[x]] t=Table[0, {256}]; Do[s=f[n]; If[s<257&&t[[s]]==0, t[[s]]=n], {n, 3, 1000000}]; t

With[{s = Table[Count[Range[n - 1], k_ /; And[CoprimeQ[k, n], ! PrimeQ@ k]], {n, 10^3}]}, Function[{t, u}, Take[#, 63] &@ Join[{1}, Rest@ ReplacePart[t, Map[# -> Lookup[u, #][[1]] &, Rest@ Keys@ u]]]] @@ {ConstantArray[0, Max@ s], KeySort@ PositionIndex@ s}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 30 2017 *)
program: a(n) = {my(k=1); while (f(k) != n, k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 07 2019
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 06 2002
